title.narrative: ICAN Integrated Community Agriculture and Nutrition- Community Connector Follow-on

description.narrative: (Uganda): USAID's Integrated Community Agriculture and Nutrition (ICAN) activity, implemented by Abt Associates Incorporated, works with community groups to maximize economic opportunities for vulnerable households, stabilize their access to and consumption of diverse and nutritious diets, and increase social capital by reinforcing relationships among formal governance systems and communities. Through collaboration with the private sector and increasing the organizational capacity of partnering organizations, ICAN is laying the foundation for self-reliance in Uganda. .With FY 2020 funds, ICAN will scale-up its work with community groups and promote resilience. ICAN's mother care groups and adolescent girls' camps will be scaled-up, and participants will continue to receive family planning and nutrition interventions. ICAN will collaborate with health activities to advance a social and behavioral change curriculum that includes safe water, sanitation and hygiene practices, latrine coverage and proper latrine use, malaria and HIV prevention, and vital messages like feeding children during illness to prevent malnutrition as a secondary effect of disease outbreak. This collaboration also includes nutrition messaging to pregnant and lactating women using Uganda's Ministry of Health curriculum, measurement of malnutrition and medical referrals, and promotion of dietary diversity and home vegetable gardens..ICAN will increase community mobilization by facilitating community members' civil society engagement to improve their access to health and social protection services. ICAN will enhance economic opportunities for 116,000 poor households by improving agriculture and non-agriculture-based livelihoods and strengthening their connections to markets and financial services. Participating communities will have stronger networks and services and be better positioned to respond to and recover from shocks and stresses........... .
